Projects

Virtual Gallery

One-off creative coding projects, often small and interactive.
2024 Flock chorus

Interactive boids-based virtual instrument.
2024 Chrome extension: HTMLophone!

Sonify any website's DOM---i.e., listen to the internet as you browse it!
2024 Chrome extension: Cat Friend!

Enhance your browsing by adding a waving cat tail "in front of" your screen.
2024 Sketch: Wonderful world

Cursed interactive playback of "What a wonderful world."
2024 Yellow Scream (2024)

Interactive homage to Kim Beomâ€™s Yellow Scream (2012).
Described in blog post Yellow Scream (2024).

2024 Sketch: Sound ripples

Interactive audio visualization.
2014 The Itinerant Mixer

Interactive spacial mixing soundstage; site currently offline. Built at Music Hack Day Boston 2014; written up by Evolver.fm in The Itinerant Mixer: Fun, Slick, and More Than a Toy .

Physical Gallery

Projects with a physical component.
2024 Scurrying seagull Fliposcope

Parallax-based mechanical flipbook animation, created with the help of CAD software Cuttle.
Described in blog post Scurrying seagull: CAD-assisted Fliposcope animation.
2024 Music box punch card generation

Transform MIDI-notated music into music roll SVGs, which can then be cut with a laser cutter. Two-stage prototype; MIDI conversion in Julia followed by SVG generation in Cuttle.
Blog post pending.

2024 HPGL.jl

Realtime audio visualization via physical pen plotter.
2024 Laser-cut CAD projects in Cuttle

Gallery of items designed with 2D CAD software Cuttle. Includes custom bookends, pattern studies, and more. Described in blog post Obsessed with Cuttle: Parametric CAD for prototyping, producing, and procrastinating.
2023 Musidex

Blog post pending.
2022 FlipDotsPi

Electromagnetic flip-disc displays used as a persistent realtime weather display.
Described in blog posts Clapping Music for two flip-disc displays and Clapping Music for one flip-disc display: Byte and variations.

2022 Miniature book collection

A set of miniature books based on a Goodreads list of books read over the course of a year.
2021 Mix of the Month club [2021]

A postcard club! Each month, postcards linking to a custom playlist were mailed to recipients.

Professional

Public-facing employment artifacts.

As a DSP/Algorithms Engineer with Beacon Biosignals:
  • 2024: FDA 510(k) clearance for SleepStageML
  • 2023: TransformSpecifications.jl library
  • 2022: Poster for American Epilepsy Society conference
  • 2020: Poster for Women in Data Science conference
As a DSP Engineer with iZotope, Inc:
  • Engineering Emmy awarded for iZotope RX 7

  • Software shipped:

    • Fall 2018: RX 7
    • Fall 2017: Ozone 8
    • Spring 2017: RX 6
    • Fall 2016: Neutron 1
    • Spring 2016: Mobius
    • Winter 2016: DDLY
    • Fall 2015: Ozone 7
    • Spring 2015: Vinyl re-release
    • Fall 2014: Ozone 6

  • Publications:

    • 2001 Patent: Systems and methods for identifying and remidiating sound masking
    • Robertson, H.; Nercessian, S., "Exploring the technology that makes RX7 Music Rebalance possible'', Sept 2018, iZotope Blog.
    • Panelist, "Tech Behind the Tools: Production to Playback'', Oct 2017, Audio Engineering Society Convention 143.
    • Interviewee, "The New Audio Podcast, Episode 7: Making the Plug-in - Neutron'', Oct 2016, iZotope's The New Audio Podcast.
    • Wichern, G.; Robertson, H.; Wishnick, A., "Quantitative Analysis of Masking in Multitrack Mixes Using Loudness Loss,'' Sep 2016, Audio Engineering Society Convention 141.
    • Wichern, G.; Wishnick, A.; Lukin, A.; Robertson, H., "Comparison of Loudness Features for Automatic Level Adjustment in Mixing,'' Oct 2015, Audio Engineering Society Convention 139.

Academic

Public-facing coursework from a MA in Music Technology at McGill University.

  • Master's Thesis: Testing a new tool for alignment of musical recordings

    Completed as a member of the Distributed Digital Music Archives & Libraries Lab (DDMAL) in the Schulich School of Music.

  • Ich Bingo!

    Ichiro Fujinaga's rules for giving a strong, well-prepared presentation, in game form.

  • Coursework:

    • MUMT 306: Music & Audio Computing I
      • Final project: Mood Typer: A Max/MSP patch for real-time content-based text sonification
    • MUMT 307: Music & Audio Computing II
      • Final project: Mimicking the fipple sound in STK
    • MUMT 501: Digital Audio Signal Processing
      • Final project: Harmonic Spectral Fit: Onset detection of slow-building attack transients [PDF] [code]
    • MUMT 618: Computational Modeling of Musical Acoustic Systems
      • Final project: Modeling the penny-whistle in STK
    • MUMT 621: Music Information Acquisition, Preservation, and Retrieval
      • Final project: Audio alignment for improved melody transcription of Irish traditional music
